summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for July 24, 2019, detailing routine prison operations and inmate statuses. The logs show inmate Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch and later moved to psychological observation, and note various security procedures and inmate movements.

persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, initially on suicide watch, then removed to psychological observation on July 24, 2019.

events.title: Epstein moved from suicide watch to psych observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was removed from suicide watch and placed on psychological observation at 11:10 AM.

events.title: Routine inmate movements and counts
events.description: Multiple institutional counts were conducted throughout the day, and several inmates were moved for court, hospital, or transport.

events.title: Security equipment malfunctions
events.description: The fire alarm and sprinkler system were reported as non-operational, requiring a fire watch. The public address system was also malfunctioning.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch and then moved to psychological observation on July 24, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The prison's fire alarm and sprinkler systems were inoperable, requiring a continuous fire watch.
Multiple security protocols, including body alarm tests, metal detector checks, and inmate counts, were documented as part of routine operations.
Several other inmates were processed, moved to court or hospital, or placed in administrative detention on the same day.
The logs show Epstein had an 'inmate companion' while on suicide watch and psychological observation.
